thread.title: Shocking footage shows moment shots were fired in west Belfast
thread.title_full: Shocking footage shows moment shots were fired in west Belfast | UTV - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Shocking footage shows moment shots were fired in west Belfast
text:
Play video By Sharon O'Neill
Shocking footage has emerged of the moment a gunman opened fire on the streets of west Belfast.
A young man was shot in the legs as a crowd gathered to watch as a suspected stolen car did handbrake turns on a main road.
The 20-year-old victim is in a stable condition in hospital.
The footage shows a suspected stolen car in all-too-common scenes on the Falls Road, but what happens next is even more shocking.
Shots ring out in an alleyway just away from view - and whoever took the film is clearly taken aback by what just happened.
Police on the scene shortly after 8.30pm.
A picture of how this man may have been targeted in such a public place is now emerging.
The entry that was the focus of such much police activity on Wednesday night is believed to be where the gunman came from.
Sources have told UTV that the first knew he had been shot was when he felt a twinge in his leg.
It is not know if gunman simply walked up to him and opened fire, or dragged him away from where he was standing with friends.
The reckless nature of the attack has caused deep shock.
Police are appealing for information but people who spoke to UTV have said they are too afraid to talk because they fear what could happen if they do.
 police Northern Ireland
